intro: Templetonia retusa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf templetonia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northeastern Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, angular stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink or red flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
